name: places/ChIJN4gbyJ5ZwokRtAUpvOm3OeU
formattedAddress: 6 St Marks Pl 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 6 St Marks Pl 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
This is an excellent gym for beginners and higher belts looking to join a gym with a positive culture and excellent instruction.
I started training here as a new white belt ~7 months ago. As a first gym, I couldn’t have asked for a better experience. The people that train here and the instructors are--to a person--dedicated, humble, and intellectually curious. Color belts and instructors are always willing to help white belts improve, answer their questions, and drill/roll with them. Often as a white belt, I will find myself at open mat rolling with Brown/Black belts, who are always happy to give detailed feedback on tweaks, details, and improvements to my moves. My understanding is that this level of feedback is not the norm across gyms and is a testament to the culture here, which promotes an attitude of helping to develop newer people. After bringing a friend that has trained at several gyms over the last few years, he was likewise impressed with the humble and collaborative attitude of the people here at Fabio Clemente.
The beginner classes frequently have two instructors and ~10-15 participants meaning that you get lots of personalized direction and attention which helps to accelerate your progression and ensure you are not improperly drilling complex movements. Typically, beginner classes include ~ 15min of warmup/individual drills, ~30min of paired drills, and ~15min of specific sparring.
I highly encourage anyone interested in the sport or looking to switch gyms to give Fabio Clemente a shot!

originalText.text: Amazing team offering the best that BJJ can be.   I am in my late 50's with kids; been training here for over two years.  I never thought I would be doing the things I do; but the instructors carefully introduced me to the skills needed to learn BJJ.  Community is inclusive and warm.  Kids program is thoughtful and strong.  Studio is always impeccably clean.  Couldn't ask for a better place to train.

originalText.text:
I came to Fabio’s academy as a purple belt in 2017, when I was looking for a new place to train. Since day one everyone treated me like a member of their family.
The level of instruction and training partners is also high and I can definitely say that my skills improved a lot.
So if you want to improve your jiu jitsu and meet a lot of great people this is your place to go!

originalText.text: Accomplished, disciplined, and down to earth instructors. A clean and healthy training space with a tight-knit but welcoming community. Good class variety for all skills and goals. Everything you could want in a BJJ training space.

text.text: Accomplished, disciplined, and down to earth instructors. A clean and healthy training space with a tight-knit but welcoming community. Good class variety for all skills and goals. Everything you could want in a BJJ training space.

originalText.text: Beat place to train in NY. Instructors and students are all very friendly and welcoming. It’s great for Gi and No-Gi. There are multiple classes each day for all different levels. Each professor takes their time to give each student feedback and has their own unique teaching style.
